Package com.abc.pp.fifo

Interface PPBoundedFifo<T>

  • public interface PPBoundedFifo<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(T item)
      Add the specified item to the fifo.
      void addAll​(T[] items)
      Adds all of the specified items.
      void clear()
      Removes any and all items in the FIFO leaving it in an empty state.
      int getCapacity()
      Returns the maximum number of items which can be stored in this FIFO.
      int getCount()
      Returns the number if items currently in the FIFO.
      java.lang.Class<T> getItemType()
      The type of items stored.
      java.lang.Object getLockObject()
      Returns a reference to use for synchronized blocks which need to call multiple methods without other threads being able to get in.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if getCount() == 0.
      boolean isFull()
      Returns true if getCount() == getCapacity().
      T remove()
      Removes and returns the next item.
      T[] removeAll()
      Immediately removes any and all items without waiting.
      T[] removeAtLeastOne()
      Removes all the items, waiting until there is at least one to remove.
      void waitUntilEmpty()
      Waits until the fifo is empty (no timeout).
      boolean waitUntilEmpty​(long msTimeout)
      Waits until the fifo is empty with a timeout.
      void waitUntilFull()
      Waits until the fifo is full (on timeout).
      boolean waitUntilFull​(long msTimeout)
      Waits until the fifo is full with a timeout.
      void waitWhileEmpty()
      Waits while the fifo is empty (no timeout).
      boolean waitWhileEmpty​(long msTimeout)
      Waits while the fifo is empty with a timeout.
      void waitWhileFull()
      Waits while the fifo is full (no timeout).
      boolean waitWhileFull​(long msTimeout)
      Waits while the fifo is full with a timeout.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemType

        java.lang.Class<T> getItemType()
        The type of items stored.

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Returns the number if items currently in the FIFO.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if getCount() == 0.

      • isFull

        boolean isFull()
        Returns true if getCount() == getCapacity().

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes any and all items in the FIFO leaving it in an empty state.

      • getCapacity

        int getCapacity()
        Returns the maximum number of items which can be stored in this FIFO. This value never changes.

      • add

        void add​(T item)
  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Add the specified item to the fifo. If currently full, the calling thread waits until there is space and then adds the item. If this method doesn't throw InterruptedException, then the item was successfully added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • addAll

        void addAll​(T[] items)
     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Adds all of the specified items. This call may wait multiple times until all have been added. The number of items to add can exceed the capacity... it just waits until some other thread removes items to make more space. If this method doesn't throw InterruptedException, then all of the items were successfully added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • remove

        T remove()
  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Removes and returns the next item. If currently empty, the calling thread waits until another thread adds an item. If this method doesn't throw InterruptedException, then the item was successfully removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • removeAtLeastOne

        T[] removeAtLeastOne()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Removes all the items, waiting until there is at least one to remove. If currently empty, the calling thread waits until another thread adds an item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • removeAll

        T[] removeAll()
        Immediately removes any and all items without waiting. If currently empty, a zero-length array is returned (non-blocking).

      • getLockObject

        java.lang.Object getLockObject()
        Returns a reference to use for synchronized blocks which need to call multiple methods without other threads being able to get in. Never returns null.

      • waitUntilEmpty

        boolean waitUntilEmpty​(long msTimeout)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the fifo is empty with a timeout. If currently empty, the calling thread returns right away.
        Parameters:
        msTimeout - approximate maximum number of ms to wait for the fifo to become empty. If this much time elapses and it's still not empty, false is returned. A value of 0 means the waiting should never time out.
        Returns:
        true if empty, false if timed out
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitUntilEmpty

        void waitUntilEmpty()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the fifo is empty (no timeout). If currently empty, the calling thread returns right away.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitWhileEmpty

        boolean waitWhileEmpty​(long msTimeout)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits while the fifo is empty with a timeout. If not currently empty, the calling thread returns right away.
        Parameters:
        msTimeout - approximate maximum number of ms to wait while the fifo is empty. If this much time elapses and it's still empty, false is returned. A value of 0 means the waiting should never time out.
        Returns:
        true if not empty, false if timed out
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitWhileEmpty

        void waitWhileEmpty()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits while the fifo is empty (no timeout). If not currently empty, the calling thread returns right away.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitUntilFull

        boolean waitUntilFull​(long msTimeout)
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the fifo is full with a timeout. If currently full, the calling thread returns right away.
        Parameters:
        msTimeout - approximate maximum number of ms to wait for the fifo to become full. If this much time elapses and it's still not full, false is returned. A value of 0 means the waiting should never time out.
        Returns:
        true if full, false if timed out
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitUntilFull

        void waitUntilFull()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the fifo is full (on timeout). If currently full, the calling thread returns right away.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitWhileFull

        boolean waitWhileFull​(long msTimeout)
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits while the fifo is full with a timeout. If not currently full, the calling thread returns right away.
        Parameters:
        msTimeout - approximate maximum number of ms to wait while the fifo is full. If this much time elapses and it's still full, false is returned. A value of 0 means the waiting should never time out.
        Returns:
        true if not full, false if timed out
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting

      • waitWhileFull

        void waitWhileFull()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits while the fifo is full (no timeout). If not currently full, the calling thread returns right away.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting
